disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Friday 1 June to end of Saturday 2 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Friday will start with some fog, cloud cover and rain. Periods of sunny spells expected in the afternoon with a chance further showers.<br/>A light south-westerly breeze is expected to import air from France. It's possible we will see some particulates near busy roads, however its unlikely we will see 'Moderate' Particulates due to the washout effect of rainfall.<br/>Saturday will feel warmer with periods of sunshine. Air will be arriving from the Atlantic, bringing little in terms of air pollution.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'low' for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM25 Particulates<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/> <br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 2 June to end of Monday 4 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Saturday will feel warm with periods of sunshine.<br/><br/>Sunday will be mostly dry, with mist and cloud clearing many areas to allow sunny spells. <br/><br/>Monday will be mostly dry also but on the cloudy side on and feeling fresher than of late.<br/><br/>Air throughout the forecast period will be mainly arriving from the Atlantic, bringing little in terms of imported air pollution.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'low' for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM25 Particulates<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/> <br/><br/>
